task1.prompt: Select the European account which has liked the most tweets.

task2.prompt: Select all of Lane's neighbors that are *people* and have more friends than followers.

feedback.explanation: This task was very difficult to complete. There were too many things that I had to remember at once. The links were greatly occluded by the nodes, so it was very difficult to tell them apart. I used search for nodes (it has a bug, when you write some one's name and then select it from the autocomplete with the keyboard, it doesn't fire the event). I searched for Jeef first, selected it, and then searched for Robert. Being able to drag nodes was very useful. I would have thought that clicking on the legeng values on the left would provide filters, so I tried doing that, but of course it didn't work

task3.prompt: Select the *institution* from North America that has retweeted Jeffrey and mentioned Robert.

feedback.explanation: Link colors in the legend don't match the ones in the graph. Again dragging was very useful, but I had to guess what "being inactive" meant (I went for having few likes and tweets). Again, too many things to keep in mind at once. Having filters with the legend will greatly help I think

task4.prompt: Which person is frequently retweeted in this network despite being relatively inactive on twitter?
